Yes, here are some specific drills that can help you improve your endurance for basketball:

1. Suicide drills: This is a classic basketball drill that can help you build endurance, agility, and speed. Start at the baseline, sprint to the first free-throw line, and then back to the baseline. Sprint to midcourt, back to the baseline. Sprint to the opposite free-throw line, back to the baseline. Finally, sprint to the other baseline and back. Repeat multiple times.

2. 17s: Here, you run from baseline to a designated spot on the court, touch the floor, and run back to the baseline. Immediately run back out to the same spot and touch the floor again before returning to the baseline. This sequence is repeated for all 17 spots around the court.

3. Full-court sprints: Start at one baseline and sprint to the opposite baseline. Take a few seconds to recover, turn around and sprint back to the original baseline. Repeat multiple times.

4. Defensive slide drills: This drills help you improve your lateral movement, increase your endurance, and improve your defensive skills. Start in a defensive stance and slide quickly from one baseline to the other.

5. Three-man weave: This drill involves passing the ball between three players while running the full length of the court. This drill can help build endurance while also improving passing, dribbling, and teamwork skills.

Remember, to see the best results, it's essential to perform these drills regularly while also making sure to get proper rest and recovery.
